recipes.label: Dining Room: Sanguine
recipes.startdescription: After supper, the knight ponders alone. They remember a feast after victory.
recipes.description: The memory leaves a bitter taste. Only the soldier follows him now, after all.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Choleric
recipes.startdescription: After supper, the knight ponders alone. They remember a feast with friends.
recipes.description: The memory leaves a sour taste. The knight is no longer friends with one of them, after all.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Sanguine
recipes.startdescription: After breakfast, the knight ponders alone. They remember the breakfast they had upon their first arrival at the fort.
recipes.description: The memory leaves a complicated feeling, but they feel lucky that they got to know the scribe and the baron from that occasion.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Choleric
recipes.startdescription: After supper, the knight ponders alone. They remember many inspiring conversations they had with friends in Shroudburn, especially those on military tactics and strategies.
recipes.description: The knight once thought they were such like-minded friends, and yet they are going to use those tacts against each other soon…

recipes.label: Dining Room: Choleric
recipes.startdescription: The knight remembers discussing tactics with the bishop before setting out for a war. Those discussions helped the knight achieve a smooth victory without much casualties.
recipes.description: The knight realizes that the bishop has influenced them so much, that it has become a part of how they think and fight now.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Sanguine
recipes.startdescription: The Knight remembers a dinner with the Baron and the Scribe at the fort. They were arguing about some scientific topic that the Knight didn’t understand.
recipes.description: But the Knight was struck by the direct way that the Scribe talked to the Baron, and even more so that the Baron replied in a humble and lively manner.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Choleric
recipes.startdescription: The Knight remembers the fascinating conversations they used to have with the Scribe. The Knight loved to tell stories when they were the only two dinning around the table.
recipes.description: The Scribe was curious about the culture and lifestyles of people living at other places, and they always offered quite interesting perspectives.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Sanguine
recipes.startdescription: The Knight can’t help missing the fun times they spent playing cards with the Baron and the Scribe. The Scribe was an amazing card player and always won.
recipes.description: Utterly impressed, the Knight insisted the Scribe to share their secrets. The Scribe not only taught them how to guess their opponents' cards, but also their thoughts.

recipes.label: Dining Room: Choleric
recipes.startdescription: The Knight recalls a religious discussion they had with the Scribe during lunch.
recipes.description: The Scribe asked them why they believe in God. The Knight said that God had saved many soldiers of theirs from death bed.

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: The Bishop sees a familiar figure by the lake. They are waiting on a horse under the willow tree, smiling. The Lord looks young, exactly how they remember them when they were both in the Order.

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: The Lord approaches the Bishop, riding along side them. Their piercing emerald green eyes shimmering, and their face as charming as the spring blossoms. "So this will be our last fight. Our Order will be disbanded after. What's your plan?" asks the Lord.
recipes.description: "Maybe study under the church and become a clergyman." answers the Bishop. "Then I can still see you from time to time." grins the Lord. And so they did.

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: The Bishop wonders that they are about to die, since they start to dream about many past memories. They say one would see their entire life as a flashback before one die. This time, the Bishop dreams of the Knight again.

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: The Knight beamed at them on horseback, their childlike face glowing under the brilliant sunshine. The Knight jumped down from their horse and hugged the Pilgrim. The Pilgrim then introduced the Knight to the Bishop.
recipes.description: The Bishop hardly heard what the Pilgrim said. They only stared at the Knight, who knelt down before them, and kissed their ring. If only everything could have stayed this way.

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: It is the Lord's familiar voice: "I'd rather not leave them here." And then, the Bishop somehow hears an echo of their own voice: "Don't worry. I won't leave you here."

recipes.label: Bishop's Dream (or Memory)
recipes.startdescription: Someone else murmurs, their voice lost in the echo. The Lord sighs: "Alright. I'll be back soon." The Bishop again hears their own voice in the echo, saying the same words.
recipes.description: All the other voices fade. The Bishop is left with only one: "You really come back. I've never been happier in this life." Where did I go? The Bishop does not manage to find an answer before they slowly open their eyes.
